marklogic.body: 43 years ago I was 13 and bought this guitar used from my local small town music store for around $300. I played it for 2 or 3 years in the usual garage band scene â€“ at that age I didnâ€™t even know what I had. Then I did one of the stupidest things in my life. I transitioned into more acoustic music of the late 60â€™sÂ and traded the beautiful cherry ES-335 for some crappy acoustic guitar; I donâ€™t even remember what it was; it doesnâ€™t matter anymore anyway. I regretted that for 40 years. After many more guitars and years I decided to try and get my 1963 ES-335 back again. After looking and looking in the used market I just couldnâ€™t find the right one â€“ they all had the â€œtracksâ€ of who knows how many other players on them and just didnâ€™t feel right. I ordered the 1963 ES-335 Block Reissue in cherry thru Gibson Custom exactly as I remembered it when I was 13. I even went thru my parentsâ€™ old photo albums to help refresh my memory. Iâ€™ve had it for about 6 months now. I guess you would have to call it a midlife crisis or something. It wasnâ€™t cheap, but it plays, feels and sounds exactly the way I remember it did back in the 60â€™s â€“ what an absolute Joy! This wonderful guitar will have to be pried from my Cold dead hands this time.
